## ErrorAnnotations interface

Optional human-readable annotations to show alongside the actual value. You can use this to provide some context with your error message, like "expected an exception".

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface ErrorAnnotations 
```

</th><th>

</th><th>

[actual?](./case-plugin-base.errorannotations.actual.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Additional information to display before the actual value. If this is undefined or missing, nothing is shown.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[expected?](./case-plugin-base.errorannotations.expected.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Additional information to display before the expected value. If this is undefined or missing, nothing is shown.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
